subtitle: Water breaking
title: Pregnant Mom
content:
I am pregnant and I’m due next week. My water is breaking for last two days. It’s not much, only a little bit of water comes out every hour. It’s clear and not mixed with blood. I don’t have any pain or contraction. I don’t have fever either. People around me are saying that this happens when you are almost due and since there is no blood it’s not a big deal. What should I do? I live in a remote area. The nearest hospital is pretty far from here. Do I have to go to the hospital right away or can I wait for my due date? If I should wait, then do I have to take any medicine for this?

**APONJON HELP: Once your water breaks, you should go to doctor immediately. The chance of infection is very high after 18 hours from water breaking. This is bad for your baby as well. You should immediately go to the hospital or see your obstetrician without further delay.	Pregnant Mom
Water Breaking**
